abstract: Roberta Smith reviews exhibition Kehinde Wiley: A New Republic at Brooklyn Museum.
lead_paragraph: You can love or hate the artist’s works, which often insert black individuals into classic Western portraiture, but it is hard to ignore them.

headline.main: Review: ‘Kehinde Wiley: A New Republic’ at the Brooklyn Museum
headline.print_headline: Scores to Settle, Possibilities to Explore

snippet: You can love or hate the artist’s works, which often insert black individuals into classic Western portraiture, but it is hard to ignore them.
